newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Foreign inflows continue into Colombo stocks - CSE.
newsitem.headline: Foreign inflows continue into Colombo stocks - CSE.

text.p: Foreign inflows accounted for 41 percent of the total turnover on the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) in May, the exchange said in a report seen on Wednesday.
"Non-national participation accounted for 41 percent of total turnover with significant net inflows of 451 million rupees," the report said.
But total turnover in May was 1.9 billion rupees, down from 2.2 billion in April, it added.
Prices declined marginally during the month, with the all share index falling 7.6 points and the blue-chip sensitive index easing 30.9 points.
The sectors which gained during the month were construction and services, which appreciated 17 percent and 12 percent, respectively, the report said.
The diversified companies' sector gained 3.2 percent. Prominent declines were in the banking sector, which fell five percent and the plantations sector, which shed three percent, the report said.
